msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Adjusted the margin of error used to decide if a component is in 3D or not.  It was an order of magnitude too low -- as a result, normal precision errors in 3D calculations were making pushing components with 2D matrices into 3D, resulting in fuzzy text.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Fix bug http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/SDK-22457 [Gumbo_Priority] Layout bounds for FXG items are incorrect
1. Add resizeMode property with default of 'scale' to SpriteVisualElement
2. Switch the Graphic class default for the resizeMode property to 'scale'
3. Beef up the transformation and sizing logic of the SpriteVisualElement.as
4. Minor clean-up and fixes for UIComponent and UIMovieClip transformations
Tests run: checkintests, spark/primitives/graphic, graphics, graphicTags
Is noteworthy for integration: Yes, bug came from Thermo.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
SDK-20821 - DropDownList does not position dropDown to the left of anchor button when needed
Made some improvements to the PopUpAnchor positioning logic. It now uses the following algorithm:
- If the popUp does not fit on the screen, then reverse the popUpPosition (ex. below -> above, left-> right)
- If the popUp still does not fit on the screen, then go back to the original popUpPosition
- Adjust the position in the horizontal and vertical directions enough for the popUp to fit on the screen
The positioning logic does not handle rotation, but it does handle scale.
Added a protected function positionPopUp whose default implementation performs the above logic. Subclasses can override this to perform their own positioning algorithm.
Moved the CompoundTransform.decomposeMatrix function into the MatrixUtil class.
